articles.content: WASHINGTON - US Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Donald Trump in May that his name appeared in investigative files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the Wall Street Journal reported on July 23.

Netizen questions if SPH Media staff celebrated for â€˜keeping print aliveâ€™ were also affected by layoffs



By Mary Alavanza

July 23, 2025 



FacebookTwitterWhatsAppLinkedinTelegram






SINGAPORE: A netizen online has questioned whether SPH Media staff recently featuredÂ  for â€œkeeping print aliveâ€ in the city-state were among those affected by fresh retrenchments announced by SPH Media on Tuesday evening (July 22).
â€œNot sure whether any of those staff being celebrated earlier on were retrenched by SPH,â€ the user wrote on r/singapore. Another commenter said, â€œOuchâ€¦ Just one week apartâ€¦ does not look good.â€

On Tuesday, SPH Media chief executive Chan Yeng Kit announced in an internal e-mail that 11 production workers would be laid off. The affected staff had been operating two of the companyâ€™s six printing presses, as well as handling newspaper distribution duties, The Straits Times reported.

EC centre worker says â€˜distastefulâ€™ comments from â€˜entitled parentsâ€™ are taking a toll on their mental health



By Anna Maria Romero

SINGAPORE: A local Redditor who works in a public early childhood (EC) centre asked for advice on how to not be affected at work. Although they love children, what they find the hardest is being at the receiving end of â€œcondescending and distasteful remarksâ€ from â€œhorribly entitledâ€ parents.
In a July 22 (Tuesday) post on r/askSingapore, u/strugglingsince99 wrote, â€the worst comments I heard in my career come from these parents,â€ and added that the stress from these comments has taken a toll on their mental health and well-being.

      Mental Health Matters
  


      Gen Zen: It may seem small, but here's how setting passwords with positive messages boosted my confidence
  












They may seem a bit cliche, but positive affirmations in passwords or put up as notes on your table do help reframe one's mind. (Illustration: CNA/Samuel Woo)


















      Nicole Lam
